transcript.text: To what extent are you familiar with our company policy on gifts and entertainment? Select True or False for each option here, then click on Submit.

contentText.text: Are these statements about gifts and entertainment true or false?

instructionText.text: Select True or False for each option, then click on Submit.
Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

option.img: Person receiving gift with entertainment going on in the background
option.text: Johnson Controls’ policies cover every situation relating to gifts and entertainment: there are no ambiguities
When you’re receiving entertainment or gifts, you should always ask yourself: “Do they expect something from me in return?”
If the person to whom you are offering gifts or entertainment might think you expect something in return, you should not proceed
It’s best never to offer or accept gifts and entertainment: it’s just too risky

correct.text: Providing and receiving entertainment and gifts is acceptable in the right circumstances but requires good judgment and an understanding of Johnson Controls' guidelines.
Our policies can’t anticipate every situation, so you will need to consider the circumstances carefully, use your judgment or, if unsure, seek advice before you proceed.
